One more cry at the grave, 
Farewell forever, my friend.

poem:
宦情本淡薄，年貌又老醜。
紫綬與金章，於予亦何有。
有時獨隱几，荅然無所偶。
臥枕一卷書，起嘗一杯酒。
書將引昏睡，酒用扶衰朽。
客到忽已酣，脫巾坐搔首。
疎頑倚老病，容恕慚交友。
忽思莊生言，亦擬鞭其後。
translate: The official's feelings are originally light, and his years and appearance are already old and ugly. What does the purple ribbon and golden chapter mean to me? Sometimes I hide alone by the table, and I have no partner. Lying on a pillow with a book, and getting up to taste a cup of wine. The book will lead to drowsiness, and the wine will support my declining years. When the guest arrives suddenly, I am already drunk and take off my hat to scratch my head. I rely on my old illness and stubbornness, and forgive my shameful friends. Suddenly I think of Zhuang Zi's words, and I also intend to whip myself afterwards.

poem:
葛衣疎且單，紗帽輕復寬。
一衣與一帽，可以過炎天。
止於便吾體，何必被羅紈。
宿雨林笋嫩，晨露園葵鮮。
烹葵炮嫩笋，可以備朝餐。
止於適吾口，何必飫腥羶。
飯訖盥漱已，捫腹方果然。
婆娑庭前步，安穩窗下眠。
外養物不費，內歸心不煩。
不費用難盡，不煩神易安。
庶幾無夭閼，得以終天年。
translate:
Bamboo hat and thin garment, gauze cap is light and loose. One garment and one cap can pass the scorching summer days. It's just convenient for my body, why cover it with silk? 

Last night's rain soaked the forest, bamboo shoots are tender; dawn dew on the garden, peony is fresh. Cooked peony shoots and tender bamboo shoots can be breakfast. It's just suitable for my taste, why indulge in meaty smells? 

After the meal, I wash and rinse, patting my belly to find that it is full. I sway in the courtyard, walk safely under the window. External nourishment does not cost much, internal peace of mind is not disturbed. No need to use up all resources, no need to bother the soul easily at ease. Perhaps there will be no premature aging, allowing us to live a long life.

poem:
日下西牆西，風來北窗北。
中有逐涼人，單牀獨棲息。
飄蕭過雲雨，搖曳歸飛翼。
新葉多好陰，初筠有佳色。
幽深小池館，優穩閑官職。
不愛勿復論，愛亦不易得。
translate: The sun sets on the west wall in the west, and the wind blows from the north window in the north. Within are those seeking coolness, alone on their single bed. As the clouds and rain pass by, they sway and return to their flying wings. The new leaves provide much shade, and the young bamboo has a good color. In the secluded small pond house, one enjoys a leisurely and stable official position. If you don't love it, don't discuss it again; loving it is not easy to obtain.

poem:
七月中氣後，金與火交爭。
一聞白雪唱，暑退清風生。
碧樹未搖落，寒蟬始悲鳴。
夜涼枕簟滑，秋燥衣巾輕。
疎受老慵出，劉楨疾未平。
何人伴公醉，新月上宮城。
translate: In the middle of July, after the heat, gold and fire contend. I hear a song of white snow, and the heat subsides with a cool breeze. The green trees have not yet shaken off their leaves, but the cold cicadas begin to mourn. The night is cool, and the pillow and mat are slippery; the autumn air is dry, and the clothes and towels are light. Shu You is old and lazy to go out, and Liu Zhen's illness has not yet been cured. Who will accompany you to get drunk? The new moon shines on the palace city.

poem:
汲泉灑小臺，臺上無纖埃。
解帶面西坐，輕襟隨風開。
晚涼閑興動，憶同傾一杯。
月明候柴戶，藜杖何時來。
translate: Picking spring water to sprinkle on the small platform, there is no trace of dust on it. Unfastening the belt and facing the west, I sit down with my light garment billowing in the wind. In the cool evening, I am inspired to recall our shared moments of drinking together. Waiting for the moonlight to shine on the thatched cottage, when will the staff come?

poem:
食桃種其核，一年核生芽。
二年長枝葉，三年桃有花。
憶昨五六歲，灼灼盛芬華。
迨茲八九載，有減而無加。
去春已稀少，今春漸無多。
明年後年後，芳意當如何。
命酒樹下飲，停杯拾餘葩。
因桃忽自感，悲吒成狂歌。
translate: Eating peaches and planting their pits, a year later buds sprout. Two years later branches and leaves grow, three years and peaches blossom. Recalling those five or six years old, radiantly beautiful and full of fragrance. Over the next eight or nine years, there's been less and less. Last spring was already sparse, this spring even more so. What will happen in the coming years? Drinking wine beneath the tree, pausing to pick remaining flowers. Thinking of peaches, I suddenly feel sad, becoming a mad song.

poem:
世欺不識字，我忝攻文筆。
世欺不得官，我忝居班秩。
人老多病苦，我今幸無疾。
人老多憂累，我今婚嫁畢。
心安不移轉，身泰無牽率。
所以十年來，形神閑且逸。
況當垂老歲，所要無多物。
一裘煖過冬，一飯飽終日。
勿言舍宅小，不過寢一室。
何用鞍馬多，不能騎兩匹。
如我優幸身，人中十有七。
如我知足心，人中百無一。
傍觀愚亦見，當己賢多失。
不敢論他人，狂言示諸姪。
translate: In the world, I am deceived for not knowing characters; I am ashamed to attack literary works. In the world, I am deceived for not holding an official position; I am ashamed to occupy my rank. As I grow old and become sickly, I am fortunate to have no illness now. As people grow old and have many worries, my marriage and childbirth are completed. My heart is at ease and does not shift; my body is healthy and free from ties. Therefore, for the past ten years, my body and spirit have been leisurely and at ease. Especially in my declining years, I desire little. A coat to keep warm through the winter, a meal to satisfy me all day. Do not say that my house is small, it is just one room for sleeping. Why do I need so many horses? I can't ride two at a time. As a lucky person, I am one in seventeen in the world. As a satisfied person, I am unique in the world. From the sidelines, fools can also see; when it comes to themselves, they often make mistakes. I dare not talk about others, but show my nephews with crazy words.

poem:
投君之文甚荒蕪，數篇價直一束芻。
報我之章何璀璨，纍纍四貫驪龍珠。
毛詩三百篇後得，文選六十卷中無。
一麋麗龜絕報賽，五鹿連柱難支梧。
高興獨因秋日盡，清吟多與好風俱。
銀鉤金錯兩殊重，宜上屏風張座隅。
translate: The articles you send are very desolate, a few pieces are worth a bundle of straw. But my replies are brilliant, like a string of pearls from a black dragon. After the 300 poems of the Mao anthology, they are not found in the 60 volumes of the literary selection. A beautiful turtle and a rare event, five deer connected by pillars are difficult to support. Happiness comes with the end of autumn, clear recitations often accompany the good wind. Both silver hooks and gold mistakes are different, suitable for hanging on the screen at the corner of the seat.

poem:
鬢毛霜一色，光景水爭流。
易過唯冬日，難銷是老愁。
香開綠蟻酒，煖擁褐綾裘。
已共崔君約，尊前倒即休。
translate: Hair as white as frost, the river of time competes. Easily passed is only winter, hard to get rid of is old worries. Fragrant green ants in wine, warmly embracing brown silk coat. Already promised with Mr. Cui, we will drink and then pass out at the bar.

poem:
黃醅綠醑迎冬熟，絳帳紅爐逐夜開。
誰道洛中多逸客，不將書喚不曾來。
translate: Yellow wine and green spirits welcome the winter harvest, crimson curtains and red braziers open all night. Who says there are many leisurely guests in Luoyang, without reading they do not come

poem:
案頭曆日雖未盡，向後唯殘六七行。
牀下酒瓶雖不滿，猶應醉得兩三場。
病身不許依年老，拙宦虛教逐日忙。
聞健偷閑且勤飲，一杯之外莫思量。
translate: Although the calendar on my desk has not yet run out, only a few lines are left. Although the wine bottle under my bed is not full, I should still be able to drink a few times. My ailing body does not allow me to grow old, and my mediocre career makes me busy every day. Hearing that I am healthy, I take a leisurely moment to drink, but don't think too much beyond one cup.

poem:
慶弔經過嬾，逢迎跪拜遲。
不因時節日，豈覺此身羸。
translate: Celebration and mourning have passed me by, greeting and kowtowing come late. Not because of the season's day, would I feel my weak body sway.

poem:
衆老憂添歲，余衰喜入春。
年開第七秩，屈指幾多人。
translate: The old men worry about aging, while I am glad to enter spring. At the age of 70, how many people can count on their fingers?

poem:
三杯藍尾酒，一楪膠牙餳。
除却崔常侍，無人共我爭。
translate: Three cups of blue tail wine, a plate of glue tooth syrup. Except for Cui Changshi, no one competes with me.

poem:
今朝吳與洛，相憶一欣然。
夢得君知否，俱過本命年。
translate: Today, I recall Wu and Lu with a sense of joy. Do you know, my dear, we have both passed our zodiac year?

poem:
同歲崔何在，同年杜又無。
應無藏避處，只有且歡娛。
translate: Who is Cui and who is Du, both of the same age? There's no hiding place to be found; we must enjoy ourselves while we can.

poem:
潦倒守三川，因循涉四年。
推誠廢鉤距，示耻用蒲鞭。
以此稱公事，將何銷俸錢。
雖非好官職，歲久亦妨賢。
translate: In the three rivers, I drift with time; four years have passed since then. Honesty is preferred, hooks and distances are abandoned; shame is shown through braided willows, and the rattan whip is used to teach. In handling official business like this, how can salary be spent? Although it's not a good job, it has also hindered the talented for a long time.

poem:
雪夜閑遊多秉燭，花時蹔出亦提壺。
別來少遇新詩敵，老去難逢舊飲徒。
大振威名降北虜，勤行惠化活東吳。
不知歌酒騰騰興，得似河南醉尹無。
translate: In the snowy nights, I leisurely wander with a torch; during the blooming season, I occasionally emerge with a jug. Since parting, I have met few poets to rival; as I grow older, it's hard to find old drinking companions. You have greatly enhanced your reputation by subduing the northern barbarians; through your diligence, you have brought prosperity to the east. I don't know if the joy of singing and drinking can match that of the drunken magistrate in Henan.

poem:
北闕至東京，風光十六程。
坐移丞相閣，春入廣陵城。
紅斾擁雙節，白鬚無一莖。
萬人開路看，百吏立班迎。
閫外君彌重，尊前我亦榮。
何須身自得，將相是門生。
translate: From the northern palace to the eastern capital, sixteen miles of magnificent scenery. Sitting in the prime minister's tower, spring enters the city of Guangling. Red flags surround the double festival, and white hair is not a single strand. Thousands of people open the path to watch, and hundreds of officials stand in line to greet. Outside the border, the king is ever more important, and before the honor, I am also honored. Why need personal achievement, the general and the minister are disciples.

poem:
雲髻飄蕭綠，花顏旖旎紅。
雙眸剪秋水，十指剝春蔥。
楚豔爲門閥，秦聲是女工。
甲明銀玓瓅，柱觸玉玲瓏。
猨苦啼嫌月，鶯嬌語䛏風。
移愁來手底，送恨入弦中。
趙瑟清相似，胡琴鬧不同。
慢彈迴斷雁，急奏轉飛蓬。
霜珮鏘還委，冰泉咽復通。
珠聯千拍碎，刀截一聲終。
倚麗精神定，矜能意態融。
歇時情不斷，休去思無窮。
燈下青春夜，尊前白首翁。
且聽應得在，老耳未多聾。
translate: Hair like clouds drifting, flowers' colors intertwined. Bright eyes like autumn waters, ten fingers like spring onions. Elegance of the Chu State represents her family, Qin music is her skill. A jade necklace shines, its pillars touch with a ringing sound. The gibbon's sorrowful cry distasts the moon, the oriole's tender speech caresses the wind. Moving sorrow enters the strings, sending hatred along. The Zhao zither sounds clear, the Hu qin makes noise differently. Slowly play the broken geese, quickly play the flying pompom. The frost ornament jingles and falls, the ice fountain gurgles and resumes. Thousands of beads break, one sound cuts off. Leaning on her beauty, her spirit is calm; proud of her abilities, her mood melts. When she rests, her feelings don't stop; when she leaves, her thoughts are endless. In the youth night under the lamp, an old man holds his cup before him. Listen to it for a while, your ears won't become too deaf.

poem:
莫歎年將暮，須憐歲又新。
府中三遇臘，洛下五逢春。
春樹花珠顆，春塘水麴塵。
春娃無氣力，春馬有精神。
並轡鞭徐動，連盤酒慢巡。
經過舊鄰里，追逐好交親。
笑語銷閑日，酣歌送老身。
一生歡樂事，亦不少於人。
translate: Don't sigh at the approaching end of the year, cherish the fresh start of spring. In the government compound, three winters have passed; in the city of Luoyang, five springs have been experienced. The spring trees are adorned with pearl-like blossoms, and the spring ponds are filled with curly sediment. The spring children are exhausted, but the spring horses are full of spirit. Side by side, we whip our horses slowly, and we slowly circulate our cups of wine. We pass by our former neighbors and friends, laughing and joking to pass the time. With our laughter and songs, we send off our aging selves. Throughout our lives, joyous occasions do not fall short of those of others.

poem:
自請假來多少日，五旬光景似須臾。
已判到老爲狂客，不分當春作病夫。
楊柳花飄新白雪，櫻桃子綴小紅珠。
頭風不敢多多飲，能酌三分相勸無。
translate: How many days I ask for leave, fifty days seem but a moment. I have decided to grow old as a madman, not distinguishing between spring and illness. Willows' flowers fall like new snow, cherry blossoms adorn with small red pearls. I dare not drink too much due to my headache, I can only take a sip and offer it to you.

poem:
欲去公門返野扉，預思泉竹已依依。
更憐家醞迎春熟，一甕醍醐待我歸。
translate: To leave the public gate and return to the wild, I anticipate the verdant springs and bamboo groves. Even more, I cherish the home-brewed wine ripe for the spring, a jar of nectar waiting for my return.

poem:
陋巷乘籃入，朱門挂印迴。
腰間拋組綬，纓上拂塵埃。
屈曲閑池沼，無非手自開。
青蒼好竹樹，亦是眼看栽。
石片擡琴匣，松枝閣酒杯。
此生終老處，昨日却歸來。
translate: Entering the narrow lane with a basket, returning from the red gate with a seal. Casting off the sash and tassels at the waist, brushing off the dust from the tassels. Bending the secluded ponds and wetlands, all created by my own hands. The green and lush bamboo trees, planted with my own eyes. Lifting the stone for the harp case, placing the wine cup on the pine branch. This is where I will spend my final days, returning yesterday.

poem:
官初罷後歸來夜，天欲明前睡覺時。
起坐思量更無事，身心安樂復誰知。
translate: The night after leaving my official duties, as the sky prepares to brighten; I wake up to ponder and find no worries, who else would understand this state of physical and mental tranquility?

poem:
疑因星隕空中落，歎被泥埋澗底沈。
天上定應勝地上，支機未必及支琴。
提攜拂拭知恩否，雖不能言合有心。
translate: Suspecting because stars fall in the sky, sighing as mud buries the bottom of the ravine. Certainly heaven must be better than earth, and the supporting machine may not equal the supporting zither. Do you know gratitude for holding and polishing? Although it cannot speak, it has a heart.

poem:
身慵難勉強，性拙易遲迴。
布被辰時起，柴門午後開。
忙驅能者去，閑逐鈍人來。
自喜誰能會，無才勝有才。
translate: It is difficult to force myself to be lazy, and my nature makes it easy for me to be slow. I get up at dawn and open the wooden door in the afternoon. Busy driving away those who are able, and leisurely pursuing those who are slow. Who can understand my self-esteem? Not talent, but lack of talent.

poem:
託質依高架，攢花對小堂。
晚開春去後，獨秀院中央。
霽景朱明早，芳時白晝長。
穠因天與色，麗共日爭光。
剪碧排千萼，研朱染萬房。
煙條塗石綠，粉蘂撲雌黃。
根動彤雲涌，枝搖赤羽翔。
九微燈炫轉，七寶帳熒煌。
淑氣熏行徑，清陰接步廊。
照梁迷藻梲，耀壁變雕牆。
爛若藂然火，殷於葉得霜。
臙脂含臉笑，蘇合裛衣香。
浹洽濡晨露，玲瓏漏夕陽。
合羅排勘纈，醉暈淺深妝。
乍見疑迴面，遙看誤斷腸。
風朝舞飛燕，雨夜泣蕭娘。
桃李慙無語，芝蘭讓不芳。
山榴何細碎，石竹苦尋常。
蕙慘偎欄避，蓮羞映浦藏。
怯教蕉葉戰，妬得柳花狂。
豈可輕嘲詠，應須痛比方。
畫幈風自展，繡繖蓋誰張。
翠錦挑成字，丹砂印著行。
猩猩凝血點，瑟瑟蹙金匡。
散亂萎紅片，尖纖嫩紫芒。
觸僧飄毳褐，留妓冒羅裳。
寡和陽春曲，多情騎省郎。
緣誇美顏色，引出好文章。
東顧辭仁里，西歸入帝鄉。
假如君愛殺，留著莫移將。
translate: Relying on high scaffolds, accumulating flowers in small courtyards. Late spring opens after the end of spring, standing alone in the center of the courtyard. Clear scenery in the early morning of Zhu Ming, and long bright days. Rich in natural color, beautiful and competing for light with the sun. Cutting thousands of buds and inking thousands of chambers. Smoke lines are painted with green stones, and powder petals are sprinkled with female yellow. Roots move, red clouds surge, branches sway, and crimson feathers fly. The nine-dimensional lamp rotates brilliantly, and the seven-treasured tent glows brightly. The beneficial air perfumes the path, and the clear shade connects the corridor. The beams are dazzled by algae, and the walls are transformed into carved walls. It's bright like a cluster of fire, and it's rich in frost like leaves. Lipstick contains a face smile, and Suohe wraps a clothes fragrance. Morning dew is moist, and the sun sets in the evening. Combining luo patterns, checking makeup, shallow and deep. Suddenly seeing a mirror makes you doubt your face, and looking at it from a distance makes you mistakenly break your heart. In the wind, the spring dance flies like a swallow; in the rain, Xiao Niang cries. Peach and Li are ashamed to be silent, and Chinese lantern is not fragrant. How small is the mountain peach? Stone bamboo is common. Watting the railing avoids the column, and Lotus hides in the pond. Fearful that the banana leaf battles, jealous of willow flower madness. Can it be easily mocked and composed? It should be painstakingly compared. The painted screen winds itself, and the embroidered umbrella is held up by whom? Emerald silk forms words, vermilion sand prints lines. Gorilla coagulates blood spots, and agate tightens golden buckles. Scattered and withered red pieces, sharp and fine purple blades. Touching the monk's downy brown robe, leaving the courtesan's silk gown. Weak harmony of spring music, affectionate cavalry provincial gentleman. Praising beauty in words, inspiring good articles. East looks back at Benren Village, west returns to the imperial town. If you love it, keep it and don't move it.

poem:
夜深吟罷一長吁，老淚燈前濕白鬚。
二十年前舊詩卷，十人酬和九人無。
translate: In the dead of night, I finish reciting and take a deep breath; my old tears wet my white beard before the lamp. Twenty years ago, in the old poetry collection, nine out of ten people responded to my verses, but one was lost.

poem:
笋老蘭長花漸稀，衰翁相對惜芳菲。
殘鶯著雨慵休囀，落絮無風凝不飛。
行掇木芽供野食，坐牽蘿蔓挂朝衣。
十年分手今同醉，醉未如泥莫道歸。
translate: As bamboo shoots grow old and orchids bloom less, the elderly men cherish the fragrant flowers. The remaining orioles are lazy to sing in the rain, and fallen catkins remain still without wind. Walking to pick wood buds for wild food, sitting to pull ivy vines on their morning clothes. After ten years of separation, we drink together now; don't say you'll go home before getting drunk like mud.

poem:
綸閣沈沈無寵命，蘇臺籍籍有能聲。
豈唯不得清文力，但恐空傳冗吏名。
郎署迴翔何水部，江湖留滯謝宣城。
所嗟非獨君如此，自古才難共命爭。
translate: In the silent imperial study, no favor is bestowed; in Su's tower, there are talents heard. Not only does one lack literary prowess, but also their name may be misused by an overbearing official. The young official flies with the water department, and thanks to Xie of Xiangyang for staying in the rivers and lakes. Alas, it's not just you who suffer; since ancient times, talent has been hard to share with fate.

poem:
吾師道與佛相應，念念無爲法法能。
口藏宣傳十二部，心臺照耀百千燈。
盡離文字非中道，長住虛空是小乘。
少有人知菩薩行，世間只是重高僧。
translate: My teacher's path corresponds to Buddhism, and his actions are always in harmony with the Dharma. He preaches the twelve divisions from his mouth, and his heart shines like a thousand lamps. Leaving behind words does not mean the middle way, and dwelling in emptiness is considered lesser attainment. Few people know of the Bodhisattva's journey, and in the world, only high priests are highly regarded.

poem:
紫袍朝士白髯翁，與俗乖疎與道通。
官秩三迴分洛下，交遊一半在僧中。
臭[帤]世界終須出，香火因緣久願同。
齋後將何充供養，西軒泉石北窗風。
translate: The purple robed official with white whiskers, disconnected from the world but connected to the way. His rank has been divided three times in the city of Luoyang, and half of his friends are monks. The stinky world must eventually be left behind, and the fragrance of incense and fire has long been desired. What will be offered after the meal? The west pavilion, the spring and stone, and the north window breeze.

poem:
昨日三川新罷守，今年四皓盡分司。
幸陪散秩閑居日，好是登山臨水時。
家未苦貧常醞酒，身雖衰病尚吟詩。
龍門泉石香山月，早晚同遊報一期。
translate: Yesterday, the Three Rivers were newly relieved from guard duty; this year, all four white-haired sages have their own responsibilities. Fortunately, I am accompanied by leisurely days in my scattered official rank; it's a good time to climb mountains and gaze at the water. My home is not too poor, always making wine; although my body is weak and sick, I still recite poetry. Dragon Gate springs and Baiyun Mountain's moon: we will enjoy each other's company soon.

poem:
併失鵷鸞侶，空留麋鹿身。
只應嵩洛下，長作獨遊人。
translate: Lost the phoenix and crane companions, leaving only the elk and deer body. Only should be below Mount Song and Luoyang, forever a solitary traveler.

poem:
長夜君先去，殘年我幾何。
秋風滿衫淚，泉下故人多。
translate: The night is long, my lord has gone first; I am left with only a few years in my twilight years. The autumn wind caresses my sleeves with tears, and those who were once dear to me are now buried beneath the earth.

poem:
青莎臺上起書樓，綠藻潭中繫釣舟。
日晚愛行深竹裏，月明多上小橋頭。
蹔嘗新酒還成醉，亦出中門便當遊。
一部清商聊送老，白鬚蕭颯管弦秋。
translate: On the green mat platform rises a library tower, where fishing boats are tied in the verdant algae pond. Deep into the bamboo groves at dusk, I love to wander; often on the small bridge, I gaze at the bright moon. Tasting new wine briefly, I become intoxicated; leaving the inner gate, I embark on my journey. Playing a tune from the clear melodies, I pass my old age; my white hair and sparse beard blend with the strings of autumn.

poem:
昨夜涼風又颯然，螢飄葉墜臥牀前。
逢秋莫歎須知分，已過潘安三十年。
translate: Last night the cool breeze blew again, fireflies fluttering and leaves falling before my bed. Don't sigh at the arrival of autumn; you know your time is limited, for you have already lived thirty years past Pan An.

poem:
蹔辭八座罷雙旌，便作登山臨水行。
能以忠貞酬重任，不將富貴礙高情。
朱門出去簪纓從，絳帳歸來歌吹迎。
鞍轡鬧裝光滿馬，何人信道是書生。
translate: Resigning from my high position, I now embark on a journey of mountain climbing and river wandering. With loyalty and devotion, I fulfill my responsibilities without being hindered by worldly wealth. Leaving the red gates behind, I venture forth with my ceremonial cap and tassel, returning home to the sound of singing and blowing. My horse is adorned in bright trappings as I travel, unknown to many that I am but a scholar at heart.

poem:
稱意新官又少年，秋涼身健好朝天。
青雲上了無多路，却要徐驅穩著鞭。
translate: The new official in his prime, young and healthy in the cool autumn, ascends the blue cloud not knowing how many paths lie ahead, but he must steady his reins and drive slowly.

poem:
闕塞龍門口，祇園鷲嶺頭。
曾隨減劫壞，今遇勝緣修。
再瑩新金剎，重裝舊石樓。
病僧皆引起，忙客亦淹留。
四望窮沙界，孤標出贍州。
地圖鋪洛邑，天柱倚崧丘。
兩面蒼蒼岸，中心瑟瑟流。
波翻八灘雪，堰護一潭油。
臺殿朝彌麗，房廊夜更幽。
千花高下塔，一葉往來舟。
岫合雲初吐，林開霧半收。
靜聞樵子語，遠聽棹郎謳。
官散殊無事，身閑甚自由。
吟來攜筆硯，宿去抱衾裯。
霽月當窗白，涼風滿簟秋。
煙香封藥竈，泉冷洗茶甌。
南祖心應學，西方社可投。
先宜知止足，次要悟浮休。
覺路隨方樂，迷塗到老愁。
須除愛名障，莫作戀家囚。
便合窮年住，何言竟日遊。
可憐終老地，此是我菟裘。
translate: At the Dragon Gate of the Gap, on the Crest of the Vulture Peak. Once destroyed in the past destinies, now repaired by favorable karma. Refreshing the new golden temple, re-decorating the old stone tower. The ailing monks are all awakened, even busy guests stay for a while. In every direction, the vast desert stretches; alone, it stands out among the provinces. The map spreads across Luoyang, the pillar leans on Mount Song. On either side, the green banks rise; at the center, the clear stream flows. Waves roll like eight sandbars covered in snow, an irrigation dam protects a pond full of oil. The temples and pavilions are beautifully adorned during the day, the corridors and rooms are even more serene at night. Thousands of flowers adorn the towers high and low, single leaves carry boats back and forth. Clouds begin to emerge from the mountains as the mist starts to dissipate. One can hear the sound of the woodcutter's voice and the singing of the boatman from afar. The officials have dispersed, leaving nothing to do; one's body is at leisure and very free. Taking pen and ink with you when reciting poetry, embracing the quilt at night. The clearing moonlight shines through the window, the cool breeze fills the mat during autumn. The smoke from the incense burns with a sweet scent, the spring water coolly washes the tea cup. Learn from the southern ancestor's heart, invest in the western congregation. First know when to stop, then understand transient pleasure and pain. Follow the path of enlightenment, free yourself from attachment to fame and home. Stay here for the rest of your life, why would you ever want to travel during the day? This is the place where I will spend my final years.

poem:
無嗟別青瑣，且喜擁朱輪。
五十得三品，百千無一人。
須勤念黎庶，莫苦憶交親。
此外無過醉，毗陵何限春。
translate:
No sighs for parting from the verdant lattice, 
Instead, rejoicing in embracing the red chariot. 
At fifty, I attain the rank of three grades, 
A hundred thousand people, yet none can match my achievements. 
I must diligently care for the common people, 
Not painfully missing my close relatives and friends. 
Besides drunkenness, what else is there to celebrate? 
In Pylou, endless springs of beauty await.

poem:
新詩絕筆聲名歇，舊卷生塵篋笥深。
時向歌中聞一句，未容傾耳已傷心。
translate: The sound of new poems is silenced, the old scrolls accumulate dust in the cabinet. From time to time, I hear a phrase in a song, and before I can listen carefully, it already hurts my heart.

poem:
靖安客舍花枝下，共脫青衫典濁醪。
今日洛橋還醉別，金杯翻汙麒麟袍。
喧闐夙駕君脂轄，酩酊離筵我藉糟。
好去商山紫芝伴，珊瑚鞭動馬頭高。
translate: Under the flower branches of the peaceful guesthouse, we share a drink together, removing our green robes to pay for the muddy wine. Today, we drunkenly part ways at the Luoyi Bridge, with our golden cups smearing our qilin robes. The noisy carriage leaves, and I leave the drunken farewell banquet, using the leftover wine as a pillow. Farewell, my friend, may you journey with the purple mushrooms of Mount Shang, with your coral whip stirring up the horse's spirit.

poem:
五度龍門點額迴，却緣多藝復多才。
貧泥客路黏難出，愁鎖鄉心掣不開。
何必更遊京國去，不如且入醉鄉來。
吳弦楚調瀟湘弄，爲我殷勤送一杯。
translate: After five times at the Dragon Gate, I return with my talents and skills. The muddy path of life is sticky and difficult to escape, and the sorrow of hometown weighs heavily on my heart. Why travel to the capital again, when you can instead enter the land of drunkenness? Let the melodies of Wu and Chu soothe my soul as I raise my cup in gratitude.

poem:
白衣居士紫芝仙，半醉行歌半坐禪。
今日維摩兼飲酒，當時綺季不請錢。
等閑池上留賓客，隨事燈前有管弦。
但問此身銷得否，分司氣味不論年。
translate: The white-robed layman and the purple mushroom fairy, half drunk with singing and half practicing meditation. Today, Vimalakirti combines drinking wine, at that time, Qi Ji does not need to ask for money. Casual guests are entertained on the pond, and pipes and strings are present before the lamp. Only ask if this body can be consumed, and whether the division of tastes and smells matters.

poem:
把酒思閑事，春愁誰最深。
乞錢羈客面，落第舉人心。
月下低眉立，燈前抱膝吟。
憑君勸一醉，勝與萬黃金。
translate: Toasting to leisurely thoughts, who feels spring sorrow most deeply? Begging for money, the wandering traveler's face, the defeated candidate's heart. Gazing down, standing beneath the moon, kneeling, reciting before the lamp. I ask you to encourage a drunkenness, better than a fortune of gold.

poem:
把酒思閑事，春嬌何處多。
試鞍新白馬，弄鏡小青娥。
掌上初教舞，花前欲按歌。
憑君勸一醉，勸了問如何。
translate: Thinking of leisurely matters while drinking, where can spring beauty be found? Trying the saddle on a new white horse, playing with the mirror and the young maiden. First teaching her to dance in the palm of your hand, and then preparing to sing before the flowers. I ask you to drink and get drunk, and when you're done, ask how it feels.

poem:
白露凋花花不殘，涼風吹葉葉初乾。
無人解愛蕭條境，更繞衰藂一匝看。
translate: The dewdrops wither the flowers but they don't remain, the cool wind dries the leaves but they are not yet withered. No one understands to love the desolate scene, so I must take a closer look around the withered cluster once more.

poem:
文昌列宿徵還日，洛浦行雲放散時。
鵷鷺上天花逐水，無因再會白家池。
translate: The constellations of Wenchang are gathering for the return day, and the clouds in the Luoyang River are dispersing at the right time. The phoenix and cranes are flying up to the sky with flowers and water, making it impossible to meet again at the White Garden Pond.

poem:
依仁臺廢悲風晚，履信池荒宿草春。
自問老身騎馬出，洛陽城裏覓何人。
translate: The abandoned Yi Ren Terrace mourns the late breeze, and the deserted Lui Sin Pool awakens with the spring wild grass. I ask myself, an old man on horseback, who am I seeking in the bustling Luoyang City?

poem:
敦詩說禮中軍師，重士輕財大丈夫。
常與師徒同苦樂，不教親故隔榮枯。
花鈿坐繞黃金印，絲管行隨白玉壺。
商皓老狂唯愛醉，時時能寄酒錢無。
translate: The poet speaks of the military strategist, the noble man who values his subjects over wealth. He is always with his disciples in joy and sorrow, not letting his close relatives be separated by prosperity and adversity. The golden seal surrounds him as he sits, with the silk pipe following the jade vase. The old merchant loves to get drunk, always sending money for wine.

poem:
合聚千羊毳，施張百子弮。
骨盤邊柳健，色染塞藍鮮。
北製因戎剏，南移逐虜遷。
汰風吹不動，禦雨濕彌堅。
有頂中央聳，無隅四嚮圓。
傍通門豁爾，內密氣溫然。
遠別關山外，初安庭戶前。
影孤明月夜，價重苦寒年。
軟煖圍氈毯，鎗摐束管弦。
最宜霜後地，偏稱雪中天。
側置低歌座，平鋪小舞筵。
閑多揭簾入，醉便擁袍眠。
鐵檠移燈背，銀囊帶火懸。
深藏曉蘭焰，闇貯宿香煙。
獸炭休親近，狐裘可棄捐。
硯溫融凍墨，瓶煖變春泉。
蕙帳徒招隱，茅庵浪坐禪。
貧僧應歎羨，寒士定留連。
賓客於中接，兒孫向後傳。
王家誇舊物，未及此青氈。
translate: United in thousands of sheep wool, spread out in hundreds of child's ropes. Bones by the willow tree, color stained with northern blue. Originated from the north for war, moved south to chase the enemy. The tide wind cannot move it, the rain makes it even more solid. In the center, it stands tall, round and without corners in all directions. With open doors on both sides, warm air inside. Far away from the mountains and rivers, first placed in front of the courtyard gates. In the lonely moonlit night, its value is heavy in the bitter cold winter. Wrapped in soft woolen rugs, accompanied by the sound of musical instruments. It is best suited for the frost-covered land, especially in the middle of snow. Set up low singing seats, spread out small dancing platforms. Enter casually through the curtains, drunk, you can embrace your robe and sleep. Move the iron lamp behind the candle, hang the silver bag with fire. Hidden away the morning orchid flame, storing the fragrance smoke for the night. Keep your distance from the beast coal, you can discard the fox fur. Warm the ink stone with melted frozen ink, the spring spring in the warmed bottle. The hidden pavilion invites seclusion, the grass hut casually sits in meditation. The poor monk should envy it, the cold scholar must stay connected. Welcome guests and relatives, pass down to children and grandchildren. The Wang family boasts of their old things, but they don't compare to this green mat.

poem:
幸免非常病，甘當本分衰。
眼昏燈最覺，腰瘦帶先知。
樹葉霜紅日，髭鬚雪白時。
悲愁緣欲老，老過却無悲。
translate: Fortunately avoiding serious illness, I willingly accept my aging fate. My eyes grow dim as the light becomes most noticeable, and my waistline thinning is an early warning of age. As fallen leaves turn red in the frost and sunlight, my whiskers turn white with snow. Sadness and sorrow come from the approaching old age, but once old, there is no longer any sadness.

poem:
平陽舊宅少人遊，應是遊人到即愁。
布穀鳥啼桃李院，絡絲蟲怨鳳皇樓。
臺傾滑石猶殘砌，簾斷珍珠不滿鉤。
聞道至今蕭史在，髭鬚雪白向明州。
translate: The old residence in Pingyang is less visited by people, and those who come should be sad. The oriole sings in the peach and apricot garden, and the silkworm complains of the Phoenix Tower. The stage is tilted, with remnants of slippery stones; the curtain is broken, and the pearls are not fully hooked. It is said that Xiao Shi is still around, with snow-white whiskers heading to Mingzhou.

poem:
南國碧雲客，東京白首翁。
松江初有月，伊水正無風。
遠思兩鄉斷，清光千里同。
不知娃館上，何似石樓中。
translate: Southern Dynasty's azure-clad guest, Eastern Capital's white-haired elder. The river Ming hangs a new moon, the Yi River is calm without wind. Distant thoughts are severed between two towns, yet the bright light spans a thousand miles. Unaware of the child's pavilion above, how does it compare to the stone tower within?

poem:
起戴烏紗帽，行披白布裘。
爐溫先煖酒，手冷未梳頭。
早起煙霜白，初寒鳥雀愁。
詩成遣誰和，還是寄蘇州。
translate: Wearing a black cap, I walk in a white cloth jacket. The furnace warms the wine first, my hands are cold and I have not combed my hair. Early in the morning, the smoke and frost are white, and the birds and birds are worried in the early cold. Who should I send the poem to? I still want to send it to Suzhou.

poem:
樓上金風聲漸緊，月中銀字韻初調。
促張弦柱吹高管，一曲涼州入泬寥。
translate: The wind on the upper floor carries a gradually tightening melody, as the moon reflects silver characters in tune. Quickly strum the strings and play the high pipes, letting a cool tune from the Liangzhou region soar into the vast emptiness.

poem:
空山寂靜老夫閑，伴鳥隨雲往復還。
家醞滿瓶書滿架，半移生計入香山。
translate: The old man is leisurely in the empty mountain, accompanying birds and clouds as they repeat their journey. Home-brewed wine fills the bottles, and books line the shelves; half of his livelihood has been moved into the Bamboo Grove of the Fragrance Mountain.

poem:
愛風巖上攀松蓋，戀月潭邊坐石稜。
且共雲泉結緣境，他生當作此山僧。
translate: Climbing the pine canopy on the Love Wind Rock, sitting on the stone edge by the Moon Pond. Sharing a spiritual connection with the cloud and spring waters, we shall be monks of this mountain in our next life.

poem:
三歲相依在洛都，遊花宴月飽歡娛。
惜別笙歌多怨咽，願留軒蓋少踟躕。
劒磨光彩依前出，鵬舉風雲逐後驅。
從此求閑應不得，更能重醉白家無。
translate: At the age of three, we depend on each other in Luoyang; Enjoying flowers and moonlit banquets fills our joy. Regretfully parting with the sound of the flute and songs filled with sorrow; I wish to linger a while under the canopy, taking my time. The sword's sharpness shines as before; The phoenix soars high, following its destiny. From now on, seeking leisure may be impossible; Even more so, indulging in white spirits again.

poem:
珊瑚鞭嚲馬踟躕，引手低蛾索一盂。
腰爲逆風成弱柳，面因衝冷作凝酥。
銀箆穩篸烏羅帽，花襜宜乘吒撥駒。
雪裏君看何所似，王昭君妹寫真圖。
translate: Corals and whipsticks, horses pause to hesitate; gently raising my hands, I find a bowl. My waist bends like the weak willow in the wind, my face turns cold and becomes a mass of frost. The silver comb is securely placed in the black hat, the flower-adorned saddle is suitable for riding the swift horse. In the snow, what does your appearance resemble? It's the portrait of Wang Zhaojun's younger sister, painted with sincerity.

poem:
海內姑蘇太守賢，恩加章綬豈徒然。
賀賓喜色欺杯酒，醉妓歡聲遏管弦。
魚珮葺鱗光照地，鶻銜瑞帶勢衝天。
莫嫌鬢上些些白，金紫由來稱長年。
translate: The talented prefect of Suzhou, endowed with kindness, graciously bestows favors upon his subjects. At banquets, joyous faces and merry laughter overwhelm the wine and music. Fish ornaments and hawk brooches gleam brilliantly, reflecting the splendor of heavenly beauty. Do not be troubled by a few gray hairs; gold and purple symbolize long-lasting prosperity.

poem:
臘月九日煖寒客，卯時十分空腹杯。
玄晏舞狂烏帽落，藍田醉倒玉山頹。
貌偷花色老蹔去，歌蹋柳枝春闇來。
不爲劉家賢聖物，愁翁笑口大難開。
translate: On the ninth of December, warm and cold guests gather; at ten o'clock in the morning, empty cups are filled with wine. The mad dance of the dark evening wears off the black cap, and the drunken stupor lies on the jade mountains. The old face steals a moment to enjoy the flowers, and the singing steps on the willow branches as spring approaches. It is not for the sages and saints of the Liu family, but for the elderly who smile sadly, making it difficult to open their mouths.

poem:
老鶴風姿異，衰翁詩思深。
素毛如我鬢，丹頂似君心。
松際雪相映，雞羣塵不侵。
殷勤遠來意，一隻重千金。
translate: The old crane's unique appearance, the aged poet's profound thoughts. My white hair like its feathers, your red crown mirrors your heart. The pines and snow interact, untouched by the worldly dust. Your kindness in coming so far, one bird is worth a thousand gold pieces.

poem:
吳苑四時風景好，就中偏好是春天。
霞光曙後殷於火，水色晴來嫩似煙。
士女笙歌宜月下，使君金紫稱花前。
誠知歡樂堪留戀，其奈離鄉已四年。
translate: The scenery of the Wu Garden is beautiful all year round, but especially in spring. The morning light after the setting of the sun is as bright as fire, and the water is as clear as smoke on a sunny day. It's appropriate for the scholars and women to sing and dance beneath the moon, and the governor's golden and purple robe complements the flowers in front of him. I truly know that the joy can be cherished, but alas, I have been away from my hometown for four years.

poem:
尊裏看無色，杯中動有光。
自君拋我去，此物共誰嘗。
translate: In the cup, there is light moving; within the honor, there is nothing to see. Since you cast me aside, who else can enjoy this drink with me?

poem:
世上強欺弱，人間醉勝醒。
自君拋我去，此語更誰聽。
translate: In the world, the strong bully the weak; in human society, those drunk are more victorious than those awake. Since you left me behind, who else will listen to these words?

poem:
病來道士教調氣，老去山僧勸坐禪。
孤負春風楊柳曲，去年斷酒到今年。
translate: Sickness comes, Taoist priests teach us to regulate our breath; as we grow old, monks in the mountains encourage us to meditate. We disappoint the spring breeze and the willow curves, having given up wine last year, carrying it over to this year.

poem:
高臥閑行自在身，池邊六見柳條新。
幸逢堯舜無爲日，得作羲皇向上人。
四皓再除猶且健，三州罷守未全貧。
莫愁客到無供給，家醞香濃野菜春。
translate: Lying high and taking leisurely walks freely, I see willow branches on the banks of the pond rejuvenated. Fortunate to encounter a day of Tao-less governance in Yao and Shun's era, I become an ascending person like Yi, the ancient sage. The four Hermits remain strong again, and although I have relinquished my posts in three states, I am not yet completely impoverished. Do not worry about guests arriving without provisions, for my home's wine is strong, and the vegetable spring is fragrant.

poem:
非莊非宅非蘭若，竹樹池亭十畝餘。
非道非僧非俗吏，褐裘烏帽閉門居。
夢遊信意寧殊蝶，心樂身閑便是魚。
雖未定知生與死，其間勝負兩何如。
translate: Non-mansion, non-dwelling, non-Buddhist, among bamboo trees and ponds on ten acres. Not a Taoist, not a monk, not a secular official, living in seclusion with a brown cloak and a crow-feather hat. Dreaming and wandering as freely as butterflies, contentment and leisure as blissful as fish. Although we do not yet know the outcome of life and death, what is the victory or defeat within it all?

poem:
久雨初晴天氣新，風煙草樹盡欣欣。
雖當冷落衰殘日，還有陽和暖活身。
池色溶溶藍染水，花光燄燄火燒春。
商山老伴相收拾，不用隨他年少人。
translate: After long rain, the sky is bright and fresh; wind and smoke caress the grass and trees. Although it's a day of loneliness and decline, there's still warmth and vitality from the sun. The pool's hue slowly blends with the blue water, while the flower's radiance ignites the spring like a burning fire. My companions and I in Shang Mountain will enjoy ourselves, without following the whims of young people.

poem:
自笑營閑事，從朝到日斜。
澆畦引泉脉，掃徑避蘭芽。
暖變牆衣色，晴催木筆花。
桃根知酒渴，晚送一甌茶。
translate: Laughing at my idle pursuits, I spend the day from dawn to dusk. Irrigating the garden and guiding the spring, I sweep the path to avoid touching the orchid buds. As the warmth changes the color of the wall, the clear sky stimulates the blossoming of the wood-tipped pen. The peach root knows my thirst for wine, and in the evening, it sends a cup of tea.

poem:
老思不禁春，風光照眼新。
花房紅鳥觜，池浪碧魚鱗。
倚櫂誰爲伴，持杯自問身。
心情多少在，六十二三人。
translate: Old thoughts cannot resist the spring, the sunlight and wind bring fresh sights. Flowers in the greenhouse, red birds beak, pool waves, green fish scales. Who is there to lean on the oar for company? Holding a cup, I ask myself, how much of my heart and mind remains at sixty-two or thirty-three years old?

poem:
滿池春水何人愛，唯我迴看指似君。
直似挼藍新汁色，與君南宅染羅裙。
translate: Who loves the spring waters filling the pond? Only I turn back to point at you, my dear. It's like gently rubbing a fresh blue dye, which we'll use to stain your silk skirt in our southern home.

poem:
勿訝春來晚，無嫌花發遲。
人憐全盛日，我愛半開時。
紫蠟黏爲蔕，紅蘇點作蕤。
成都新夾纈，梁漢碎臙脂。
樹杪真珠顆，牆頭小女兒。
淺深妝駮落，高下火參差。
蝶戲爭香朵，鶯啼選穩枝。
好教郎作伴，合共酒相隨。
醉翫無勝此，狂嘲更讓誰。
猶殘少年興，不似老人詩。
西日憑輕照，東風莫殺吹。
明朝應爛熳，後夜更離披。
林下遙相憶，尊前闇有期。
銜杯嚼蘂思，唯我與君知。
translate: Please do not be surprised that spring comes late, nor complain about the delay in flower bloom. People cherish the full bloom stage, but I love the half-opened time. Purple wax sticks as the stem, and red Su is dotted with Ru. Chengdu's new silk cloth, Liang Han's broken yanzhi. Tree tops are genuine pearls, and wall tops have little girls. Light and heavy makeup is scattered, high and low fires are uneven. Butterflies fight for fragrant flowers, orioles choose stable branches. Let the gentleman be a companion, and share wine together. Drinking and playing are better than this, and crazy jokes let others win. The youth's enthusiasm remains, unlike an old man's poetry. The west sun relies on light, and the east wind doesn't kill it. Tomorrow should be brilliant, and the night after will be more scattered. I remember you from a distance in the woods, and there is an appointment in front of the wine cup. I think about the cup and the bud, only you and I know.

poem:
柳老香絲宛，荷新鈿扇圓。
殘春深樹裏，斜日小樓前。
醉遣收杯杓，閑聽理管弦。
池邊更無事，看補採蓮船。
translate: The willow tree is old and fragrant, the lotus is fresh and its fan is round. In the deep trees of the late spring, the slanting sun is before the small tower. Drunkenly, I send away the cup and ladle, leisurely I listen to the strings and pipes. By the pond, there is nothing more to do, just watch the fishing boat being repaired and collected.

poem:
君應怪我朝朝飲，不說向君君不知。
身上幸無疼痛處，甕頭正是撇嘗時。
劉妻勸諫夫休醉，王姪分疎叔不癡。
六十三翁頭雪白，假如醒黠欲何爲。
translate: You should blame me for drinking every day, but I don't tell you and you don't know. Fortunately, there is no pain in my body, and it is just the time to taste the wine. Liu's wife advises her husband not to get drunk, and Wang's cousin separates his uncle from foolishness. The 63-year-old man has snow-white hair, and if he is awake and clever, what should he do?

poem:
東歸多旅恨，西上少知音。
寒食看花眼，春風落日心。
百憂當二月，一醉直千金。
到處公卿席，無辭酒醆深。
translate: Many regrets in traveling eastward, few companions in traveling westward. Enjoying flowers in the cold food festival, feeling the setting sun and spring breeze. A hundred worries in February, a drunkenness worth a thousand gold pieces. At every official banquet, there is no need to refuse the deep wine cup.

poem:
手裏一杯滿，心中百事休。
春應唯仰醉，老更不禁愁。
弄水迴船尾，尋花信馬頭。
眼看筋力減，遊得且須遊。
translate: Holding a cup of wine in my hand, I let go of all worries in my heart. In spring, I should only get drunk; as I grow older, I can't bear the sorrow any more. I play with the water and turn the boat, searching for flowers as I ride my horse. Watching my strength dwindle, I must enjoy myself while I still can.

poem:
弱柳緣堤種，虛亭壓水開。
條疑逐風去，波欲上階來。
翠羽偷魚入，紅腰學舞迴。
春愁正無緒，爭不盡殘杯。
translate: Weak willows are planted along the dikes, and the empty pavilions are built on the water. Branches seem to follow the wind, and waves want to climb the steps. The green feathers steal fish, and the red waist learns to dance. Spring sorrow is in disarray, and who can't finish the remaining wine?

poem:
膩如玉指塗朱粉，光似金刀剪紫霞。
從此時時春夢裏，應添一樹女郎花。
translate: Bored, like a finger painted with red, shining like a golden knife cutting purple clouds. From this time on, in my spring dreams, there should be one more tree of flowery women

poem:
玉珮金章紫花綬，紵衫藤帶白綸巾。
晨興拜表稱朝士，晚出遊山作野人。
達磨傳心令息念，玄元留意遣同塵。
八關淨戒齋銷日，一曲狂歌醉送春。
酒肆法堂方丈室，其間豈是兩般身。
translate: Jade ornaments, golden seals, and purple sashes; silk garments with rattan belts and white silk headdresses. Rising early to pay homage to the imperial court, then venturing out to roam the mountains as a hermit. Dharma transmission to quiet the mind, and the pursuit of hidden truths in common dust. The purification of the eight Buddhist precepts on the day of the full moon, and drunkenly singing a mad song to bid farewell to spring. Between the tavern, the temple hall, and the abbot's room, is there truly a distinction between these two lives?

poem:
朱檻低牆上，清流小閣前。
雇人栽菡萏，買石造潺湲。
影落江心月，聲移谷口泉。
閑看捲簾坐，醉聽掩窗眠。
路笑淘官水，家愁費料錢。
是非君莫問，一對一翛然。
translate: Below the red railing, on the low wall, clear water flows before the small pavilion. Employing others to plant lotuses, buying stones to create a gurgling sound. The shadow of the moon over the river, the sound of the spring moving from the valley. Leisurely watching the curtain roll up and sitting, drunkenly listening to closing the window and sleeping. Joking about the official water, family worries costing money. Don't ask about the truth or falsehood, one by one, indifferently.

poem:
宿酲寂寞眠初起，春意闌珊日又斜。
勸我加餐因早笋，恨人休醉是殘花。
悶吟工部新來句，渴飲毗陵遠到茶。
兄弟東西官職冷，門前車馬向誰家。
translate: As I wake up from my drunken stupor, the lonely silence surrounds me. The spring's fading beauty, as the sun sets at an angle. You encourage me to enjoy the tender shoots, for it is a shame to leave the flowers in decay untasted. I ponder over the newly penned verses by the skilled poet, and quench my thirst with tea from afar. My brothers are scattered, their official duties keeping them apart. Before my door, the horse-drawn carriages pass by, destined for whom?

poem:
玉泉南澗花奇怪，不似花叢似火堆。
今日多情唯我到，每年無故爲誰開。
寧辭辛苦行三里，更與留連飲兩杯。
猶有一般辜負事，不將歌舞管弦來。
translate: The flowers in the southern valley of Yuquan are strange, not like a flower bed but like a pile of fire. Today, only I am affectionate, and every year for whom does it unfathomably bloom? I would rather endure the hard journey of three miles and enjoy two cups of wine. There is still one thing that I have to live up to - not bringing singing and dancing and musical instruments along.

poem:
曉服雲英漱井華，寥然身若在煙霞。
藥銷日晏三匙飯，酒渴春深一椀茶。
每夜坐禪觀水月，有時行醉翫風花。
淨名事理人難解，身不出家心出家。
translate: Wearing the clouds and dewdrops, I rinse my mouth with the well's essence; my solitary figure seems to be floating in the mist and haze. As the sun sets, I consume three spoonfuls of rice for my daily meal; in the springtime, I crave wine and a bowl of tea to quench my thirst. Each night, I meditate and observe the moon reflected in the water; sometimes, I get drunk and play with the wind and flowers. The teachings of Pure Insight are difficult for people to understand; though I have not left the world, my heart has already entered the monkhood.

poem:
晚來林鳥語殷勤，似惜風光說向人。
遣脫破袍勞報煖，催沽美酒敢辭貧。
聲聲勸醉應須醉，一歲唯殘半日春。
translate: The evening birds in the woods are talking eagerly, as if they're telling people to appreciate the scenery. They urge us to take off our worn-out robes and enjoy warmth, and encourage us to buy fine wine without worrying about poverty. We must get drunk one by one, for only half a day of spring remains in the year.

poem:
夏早日初長，南風草木香。
肩輿頗平穩，澗路甚清涼。
紫蕨行看採，青梅旋摘嘗。
療飢兼解渴，一醆冷雲漿。
translate: In the early days of summer, the sun rises higher and higher; with the south wind, grass and trees emit a delightful fragrance. The shoulder chair is quite stable, and the brookside path is very refreshing. We walk to pick purple ferns, and immediately taste the green plums. This satisfies our hunger and quenches our thirst - a cup of cold cloud porridge.

poem:
野寺經三宿，都城復一還。
家仍念婚嫁，身尚繫官班。
蕭灑秋臨水，沈吟晚下山。
長閑猶未得，逐日且偷閑。
translate: After three nights in the wild temple, I return to the capital city once more. Still concerned with family marriage, my official duties continue. As the cool autumn approaches the water, I muse as I descend the mountain in the evening. In search of lasting peace, I steal moments of leisure each day.

poem:
昔蒙興化池頭送，今許龍門潭上期。
聚散但慙長見念，榮枯安敢道相思。
功成名遂來雖久，雲臥山遊去未遲。
聞說風情筋力在，只如初破蔡州時。
translate: In the past, I was sent off at the fountain of transformation; now, I am expecting you at the Dragon Gate Pond. We gather and part, feeling ashamed of our long-lasting affection; we flourish and wither, dare not speak of our longing. Although success and fame have come after a long wait, it's not too late to leave the clouds and roam the mountains. I hear that my passion and strength are still there, just like when we first broke through Caizhou.

poem:
鸞鳳翺翔在寥廓，貂蟬蕭灑出埃塵。
致成堯舜昇平代，收得夔龍強健身。
拋擲功名還史冊，分張歡樂與交親。
商山老皓雖休去，終是留侯門下人。
translate: The phoenix and the peacock soar in the vast expanse, the sable and jade butterflies emerge from the dust. Bringing about the peaceful era of Yao and Shun, capturing the strong and healthy dragon and tortoise. Casting off fame and fortune to record history, sharing joy and happiness with friends and relatives. Although the old man of Shang Mountain has retired, he is still a disciple of Liu Zhang.

poem:
位下才高多怨天，劉兄道勝獨恬然。
貧於揚子兩三倍，老過榮公六七年。
筆硯莫拋留壓案，簞瓢從陋也銷錢。
郡丞自合當優禮，何況夷陵太守賢。
translate: Below talent is high and often complains of heaven, Liu brother's moral victory is calm. He is two or three times poorer than Yangzi, and he has been older than Rong Gong for six or seven years. Do not throw away the pen and ink, leave them on the table, and use them to spend money. The county magistrate should be treated with courtesy, let alone the intelligent governor of Yiling.

poem:
樓閣高低樹淺深，山光水色暝沈沈。
嵩煙半卷青綃幕，伊浪平鋪綠綺衾。
飛鳥滅時宜極目，遠風來處好開襟。
誰知不離簪纓內，長得逍遙自在心。
translate: The tall and short buildings with trees of varying depths, the mountain light and water colors are dim and deep. The Sangian smoke is half rolled up like a green silk screen, and the Yi river is flatly laid out like a green silk quilt. When the flying birds disappear, it's time to look far away; when the distant wind blows, it's time to open your arms. Who knows that without leaving the hairpin, one can grow a heart of carefree freedom.

poem:
六么水調家家唱，白雪梅花處處吹。
古歌舊曲君休聽，聽取新翻楊柳枝。
translate: Every family sings the "Six Pecks" tune, as snow-white plum blossoms bloom everywhere. Don't listen to the old songs and tunes - hear instead the newly translated "Willow Branch."

poem:
陶令門前四五樹，亞夫營裏百千條。
何似東都正二月，黃金枝映洛陽橋。
translate: In front of Tao's residence are four or five trees, in Yifei camp a thousand or more branches. How like the east capital in early spring, golden branches reflecting over Luoyang bridge.

poem:
依依褭褭復青青，句引春風無限情。
白雪花繁空撲地，綠絲條弱不勝鶯。
translate: With a gentle sway and verdant green, the spring breeze whispers endless love. White flowers fall profusely on the ground, while the green silk threads are too weak to support the warbling birds.

poem:
紅板江橋青酒旗，館娃宮暖日斜時。
可憐雨歇東風定，萬樹千條各自垂。
translate: Red board bridge and green wine flag, warm sun slanting through the palace of the fairy maid. Alas, the rain has stopped and the east wind is certain, as thousands of trees droop individually.

poem:
蘇州楊柳任君誇，更有錢唐勝館娃。
若解多情尋小小，綠楊深處是蘇家。
translate: Suzhou willows and their graceful swaying are for you to admire, with the beauty of Qiantang's courtyards surpassing all. If you wish to find a tender heart, search among the green willows where the family of Su resides deeply.

poem:
蘇家小女舊知名，楊柳風前別有情。
剝條盤作銀環樣，卷葉吹爲玉笛聲。
translate: Su family's young girl was well-known in the past, her departure before the willow tree's breeze reveals a unique feeling. Peeling off her hairpins and making them into silver rings, she plays the jade flute by blowing through the leaves.

poem:
葉含濃露如啼眼，枝褭輕風似舞腰。
小樹不禁攀折苦，乞君留取兩三條。
translate: The leaves are dripping with dense dewdrops like teary eyes, and the branches are twisting in the slight breeze like a dancing waist. The young trees cannot bear the pain of being broken, please leave a few branches for us to cherish.

poem:
人言柳葉似愁眉，更有愁腸似柳絲。
柳絲挽斷腸牽斷，彼此應無續得期。
translate: People say that willow leaves look like frowning brows, and even the sorrow in their bowels resembles willow threads. When the willow threads are pulled, the sorrow bows elongates, and there should be no chance for them to reconnect.

poem:
言者不如知者默，此語吾聞於老君。
若道老君是知者，緣何自著五千文。
translate: The one who speaks is not as wise as the one who keeps silent, a saying I heard from Lord Lao. If Lord Lao is the wise one, why does he write five thousand texts himself?

poem:
莊生齊物同歸一，我道同中有不同。
遂性逍遙雖一致，鶯凰終挍勝蛇蟲。
translate: Zhuang Zi sees all things as equal, though I believe there's a difference within the same. Although freedom and joy are shared, the sparrow and phoenix surpass the snake and insect.

poem:
須知諸相皆非相，若住無餘却有餘。
言下忘言一時了，夢中說夢兩重虛。
空花豈得兼求果，陽燄如何更覓魚。
攝動是禪禪是動，不禪不動即如如。
translate: One must realize that all phenomena are not real; if one abides in non-attachment, there is actually attainment. Words are forgotten as soon as spoken; dreams discussed in a dream are doubly illusory. Empty flowers cannot bear fruit; mirage cannot provide fish. To capture movement is to grasp the essence of Zen, while Zen itself is an ever-moving state; to be un-Zen and still is to be at peace.

poem:
吉凶禍福有來由，但要深知不要憂。
只見火光燒潤屋，不聞風浪覆虛舟。
名爲公器無多取，利是身災合少求。
雖異匏瓜難不食，大都食足早宜休。
translate: Fortune and misfortune have their causes, but know them well without worrying. Only the fire lights up the house, never the wind and waves overturn the empty boat. The public property is not for personal gain, and the benefits should be sought sparingly. Although the gourd is different, it's hard to resist eating; mostly when full, it's time to rest early.

poem:
魚能深入寧憂釣，鳥解高飛豈觸羅。
熱處先爭炙手去，悔時其奈噬臍何。
尊前誘得猩猩血，幕上偷安鷰鷰窠。
我有一言君記取，世間自取苦人多。
translate: The fish can dive deep without worrying about being caught, and the birds can fly high without touching the net. In hot places, we compete to escape from the scorching heat, but in retrospect, there is nothing we can do about regretting our actions. At the wine ceremony, we attract people with our charisma, and secretly settle down in the shadows. I have a word for you to remember: in the world, those who suffer are often those who seek it themselves.

poem:
烏鳶爭食雀爭窠，獨立池邊風雪多。
盡日蹋冰翹一足，不鳴不動意如何。
translate: The crows and magpies fight for food, the sparrows for a nest; standing alone by the pond, the wind and snow are abundant. All day long, one foot trods on the ice; making no sound, moving no more - what does this mean?

poem:
鷹爪攫雞雞肋折，鶻拳蹴雁雁頭垂。
何如歛翅水邊立，飛上雲松棲穩枝。
translate: The eagle's talons grasp the chicken, breaking its tendons; the hawk's fists kick the wild goose, causing its head to droop. Why not fold your wings and stand by the water, flying up to the cloud-capped pines to perch on a stable branch?

poem:
向夕搴簾臥枕琴，微涼入戶起開襟。
偶因明月清風夜，忽想遷臣逐客心。
何處投荒初恐懼，誰人繞澤正悲吟。
始知洛下分司坐，一日安閑直萬金。
translate: In the twilight, I raise the curtain and lie on my pillow with a guitar. A slight chill enters the room, so I open my shirt. Occasionally, by the bright moonlight and gentle breeze, I suddenly think of the exiled officials' feelings. Where did you first fear to wander in the wilderness? Who was it around the marsh, lamenting? Only then do I realize that under the division of labor in Luoyang, a day of ease is worth tens of thousands of gold.

poem:
權門要路是身災，散地閑居少禍胎。
今日憐君嶺南去，當時笑我洛中來。
蟲全性命緣無毒，木盡天年爲不才。
大抵吉凶多自致，李斯一去二疎迴。
translate: The paths of power and influence are a source of misfortune, while secluded lives bring fewer calamities. Today, I pity you as you leave the south, while in the past, I laughed at myself for coming to the Luoyi area. Insects survive due to their lack of poison, while trees reach their natural lifespan despite their shortcomings. Generally, good or bad fortune is often self-inflicted, as seen in Li Si's journey of ups and downs.

poem:
蕭灑伊嵩下，優游黃綺間。
未曾一日悶，已得六年閑。
魚鳥爲徒侶，煙霞是往還。
伴僧禪閉目，迎客笑開顏。
興發宵遊寺，慵時晝掩關。
夜來風月好，悔不宿香山。
translate: Under the verdant hills and valleys, I wander freely with my friends. I've spent six years in leisure, never feeling bored for a single day. Fish and birds are my companions, as I traverse the mist and clouds. I accompany monks in meditation, welcoming guests with a smile. I venture out at night to visit temples, and during the day, I occasionally close the door. The moon and wind are beautiful tonight, I regret not staying at Mount Xiangshan.

poem:
愛琴愛酒愛詩客，多賤多窮多苦辛。
中散步兵終不貴，孟郊張籍過於貧。
一之已歎關於命，三者何堪併在身。
只合飄零隨草木，誰教凌厲出風塵。
榮名厚祿二千石，樂飲閑遊三十春。
何得無厭時咄咄，猶言薄命不如人。
translate: Loving wine and poetry, the traveler is lowly, poor, and hardworking. The foot soldier is not valued, while Meng Jiao and Zhang Ji are too poor. It's a pity that these three things exist in one body. Only fitting to drift with the grass and trees, who would have expected to emerge in the wind and dust. With fame and wealth, one enjoys a leisurely life for thirty years. How can one be satisfied without end, still claiming that their destiny is not as good as others.

poem:
有花有酒有笙歌，其奈難逢親故何。
近海饒風春足雨，白鬚太守悶時多。
translate: There are flowers, wine, and music, but it's hard to meet close relatives. The sea is near, the wind is strong, and it rains in spring. The white-haired governor is bored most of the time.

poem:
平陽音樂隨都尉，留滯三年在浙東。
吳越聲邪無法用，莫教偷入管弦中。
translate: The music of Pingyang accompanies the marshal, staying in Zhedong for three years. The sounds of Wu and Yue are inauspicious and cannot be used, do not let them sneak into the pipe and strings.

poem:
何郎小妓歌喉好，嚴老呼爲一串珠。
海味腥鹹損聲氣，聽看猶得斷腸無。
translate: He Lang's little singer has a wonderful voice, and Yan the old man calls it a string of pearls. The sea's fishy smell may harm her voice, but listening to her can still make one's heart break.

poem:
薄食當齋戒，散班同隱淪。
佛容爲弟子，天許作閑人。
唯置牀臨水，都無物近身。
清風散髮臥，兼不要紗巾。
translate: Thin food for fasting, dispersed classes with hidden retreat. Buddha's appearance as a disciple, heaven permits as a leisurely person. Only placing the bed by the water, nothing close to the body. The breeze spreads and lies down, no need for gauze cloth.

poem:
春早秋初晝夜長，可憐天氣好年光。
和風細動簾帷暖，清露微凝枕簟涼。
窗下曉眠初減被，池邊晚坐乍移牀。
閑從蕙草侵堦綠，靜任槐花滿地黃。
理曲管弦聞後院，熨衣燈火映深房。
四時新景何人別，遙憶多情李侍郎。
translate: In the early spring and late autumn, day and night are long. Lovely weather, a good year. The gentle breeze gently moves the curtain, and the dew slightly condenses on the pillow and mat. I wake up from my morning nap, slowly removing the coverlet from beneath my window. In the evening, I sit by the pool, moving the bed gently. I leisurely let the mingqi grass invade the steps, and quietly let the fragrant osmanthus flowers cover the ground. I hear the tune of the pipe and strings in the back garden, and the warm clothes are ironed by the light in the room. Who else will enjoy the new scenery of the four seasons? I miss the affectionate Li Servant Minister far away.

poem:
過得炎蒸月，尤宜老病身。
衣裳朝不潤，枕簟夜相親。
樓月纖纖早，波風褭褭新。
光陰與時節，先感是詩人。
translate: After the scorching heat of the sun, it's especially suitable for old and sick bodies. Clothes don't moisten in the morning, but pillows and mats are close at night. The moonlight is fine and gentle early in the morning, and the wave wind is gently new. Time and season, poets feel it first.

poem:
孟夏清和月，東都閑散官。
體中無病痛，眼下未飢寒。
世事聞常悶，交游見即歡。
杯觴留客切，妓樂取人寬。
雪鬢隨身老，雲心著處安。
此中殊有味，試說向君看。
translate: In the clear and peaceful Mengxia summer, an official at leisure in the eastern capital. No pain in the body, no hunger or cold in the eyes. Hearing of worldly affairs often makes me feel bored, but meeting with friends brings joy. The cup is reserved for guests, and the entertainers provide comfort. My snow-white hair accompanies my aging, and my heart is at ease in the clouds. There is great satisfaction in this, try to understand it for yourself.

poem:
貂冠初別九重門，馬鬣新封四尺墳。
薤露歌詞非白雪，旌銘官爵是浮雲。
伯倫每置隨身鍤，元亮先爲自祭文。
莫道高風無繼者，一千年內有崔君。
translate: Initially parting from the nine heavy gates, a sable cap is worn. A horse's mane is newly bound with a four-foot grave. The garlic and grass lyrics are not of white snow; the official rank and prestige are but fleeting clouds. Bolelun always carries his personal chisel, and Yuanliang prepares his own funeral text. Do not say that there is no successor to the high wind; in a thousand years, there will be a Cui Jun.

poem:
島樹間林巒，雲收雨氣殘。
四山嵐色重，五月水聲寒。
老鶴兩三隻，新篁千萬竿。
化成天竺寺，移得子陵灘。
心覺閑彌貴，身緣健更歡。
帝將風后待，人作謝公看。
甪里年雖老，高陽興未闌。
佳辰不見召，爭免趂杯盤。
translate: Island trees among the woods, rain clouds clearing after the storm. The four mountains shrouded in mist, the water's sound chilly in May. A few old cranes, a thousand new bamboo shoots. Transforming into the Heavenly Temple, moving to Zi Ling Beach. The heart feels serene and precious, the body is healthy and joyful. The emperor awaits the wind and the queen, people gaze at him as if he is Xie Gong. Although the aged Luo Ji is getting older, the high spirits of the Sun are still strong. The beautiful day is not summoned, who can avoid partaking in the feast?

poem:
戚里誇爲賢駙馬，儒家認作好詩人。
魯侯不得辜風景，沂水年年有暮春。
translate: Qi Li is praised as a noble horse, Confucian scholars recognize him as a talented poet. Lu Hou cannot enjoy the scenery, but the Yi River flows through the last days of spring every year.

poem:
少年怪我問如何，何事朝朝醉復歌。
號作樂天應不錯，憂愁時少樂時多。
translate: The young man strangely asked me, why I drink and sing every day. Calling myself a happy person is not wrong, for sorrow is less and joy is more.

poem:
千首詩堆青玉案，十分酒寫白金盂。
迴頭却問諸年少，作箇狂夫得了無。
translate: A thousand poems pile up on the green jade table, ten cups of wine are written in a white gold bowl. Turning back to ask the young again, is it possible to be a madman after all?

poem:
琵琶師在九重城，忽得書來喜且驚。
一紙展看非舊譜，四弦翻出是新聲。
蕤賓掩抑嬌多怨，散水玲瓏峭更清。
珠顆淚霑金捍撥，紅妝弟子不勝情。
translate: The lute player in the Nine Heavy City, suddenly receives a letter with joy and surprise. A sheet of paper opens to see an unfamiliar melody, as the four strings play new sounds. The Rui Guest melody is soft and full of longing, while the scattered water is clear and delicate. The pearls of tears wet the golden strings, and the red-dressed disciples cannot bear the emotions.

poem:
南院今秋遊宴少，西坊近日往來頻。
假如宰相池亭好，作客何如作主人。
translate: The southern courtyard has fewer autumn festivities this year, and the western alley is recently quite busy. If you enjoy the pond pavilion as a guest, what about being the host instead?

poem:
豈獨西坊來往頻，偷閑處處作遊人。
衡門雖是棲遲地，不可終朝鏁老身。
translate: Not only from the western alley do we frequently come and go, making ourselves available for leisurely strolls everywhere. Although the simple gate is a place of rest and repose, it cannot lock away my old self all morning long.

poem:
集賢池館從他盛，履道林亭勿自輕。
往往歸來嫌窄小，年年爲主莫無情。
translate: The Gathering Pool and Mansion are thriving, the Path of Footsteps Forest Pavilion is not to be taken lightly. Often returning, one finds it narrow and small, year after year as the master, there's no lack of affection.

poem:
小水低亭自可親，大池高館不關身。
林園莫妬裴家好，憎故憐新豈是人。
translate: The small pond and low pavilion are quite endearing, while the large pool and high mansion have nothing to do with us. Don't envy the Lin Garden for its beauty - to hate the past and cherish the new is not what humans should do.

poem:
天宮閣上醉蕭辰，絲管閑聽酒慢巡。
爲向涼風清景道，今朝屬我兩三人。
translate: Drunkenly enjoying the clear sky and the tower, we leisurely listen to the strings and pipes as the wine slowly circulates. To the cool breeze and the beautiful scenery, I say today belongs to just a few of us.

poem:
上陽宮裏曉鐘後，天津橋頭殘月前。
空闊境疑非下界，飄颻身似在寥天。
星河隱映初生日，樓閣蔥蘢半出煙。
此處相逢傾一醆，始知地上有神仙。
translate: After the dawn bell in the Shangyang Palace, the remaining moon over the Tianjin Bridge. The vast landscape seems to be beyond the mortal realm, and the drifting body seems to be in the boundless sky. The stars and rivers are hidden, and the buildings are shrouded in smoke. Meeting here, we share a cup, realizing that there is a heaven on earth.

poem:
月好共傳唯此夜，境閑皆道是東都。
嵩山表裏千重雪，洛水高低兩顆珠。
清景難逢宜愛惜，白頭相勸強歡娛。
誠知亦有來年會，保得晴明強健無。
translate:
Moon and beauty are shared only in this night,
Seasons of peace are all said to be in the East.
Song Mountain with its thousand layers of snow,
Luo River with its high and low twin pearls.
Clear scenery is hard to come by, so cherish it,
Elders encourage each other to have strong fun.
We know there will be a meeting next year,
Hoping for clear weather and good health.

poem:
移晚校一月，花遲過半年。
紅開杪秋日，翠合欲昏天。
白露滴未死，涼風吹更鮮。
後時誰肯顧，唯我與君憐。
translate: Moved to the evening school for a month, the flowers are late by half a year. Red blooms in the last days of autumn, green leaves cover the sky about to darken. The dewdrops are still alive, and the cool breeze makes them even fresher. Later, who will care? Only you and I are compassionate.

poem:
狂歌箕踞酒尊前，眼不看人面向天。
洛客最閑唯有我，一年四度到平泉。
translate: Singing wildly, I lean on the wine jar, my eyes raised to the sky, not looking at others. Among the leisurely Luoyi people, only I am the most at ease, for I come to Pingquan four times a year.

poem:
箕潁千年後，唯君得古風。
位留丹陛上，身入白雲中。
躁靜心相背，高低跡不同。
籠雞與梁燕，不信有冥鴻。
translate: After a thousand years of the Ji River and the Ying River, only you have retained the ancient style. You remain on the red steps, your body entering the white clouds. Your restlessness and tranquility are opposite, and your high and low traces are different. The caged chicken and the beam swallow do not believe there is a dark swan.

poem:
愛菊高人吟逸韻，悲秋病客感衰懷。
黃花助興方攜酒，紅葉添愁正滿堦。
居士葷腥今已斷，仙郎杯杓爲誰排。
媿君相憶東籬下，擬廢重陽一日齋。
translate: The elevated person who loves chrysanthemums recites the refined verses, and the ailing traveler feels the sadness of autumn. Yellow flowers are just right for carrying wine to enhance the mood, and red leaves are scattered on the steps to add to the sorrow. The lay monk has given up meat and fish, but who will arrange the cups and ladles for the immortal? I am ashamed that you remember me under the eastern hedge, planning to abandon the vegetarian diet on the Double Ninth Festival.

poem:
九燭臺前十二姝，主人留醉任歡娛。
翩翻舞袖雙飛蝶，宛轉歌聲一索珠。
坐久欲醒還酩酊，夜深初散又踟躕。
南山賓客東山妓，此會人間曾有無。
translate: Before the nine-candle stand, twelve beauties dance and sing. The host indulges them in merrymaking and revelry. Their dancing sleeves flutter like twin butterflies, while their singing voices resonate like a single string of pearls. As they sit for a long time, they become intoxicated once again; as the night deepens, they part reluctantly. The guests from the southern mountains and the courtesans from the eastern hills - has such a gathering ever existed in this world?

poem:
促席留歡日未曛，遠坊歸思已紛紛。
無妨按轡行乘月，何必逃杯走似雲。
銀燭忍拋楊柳曲，金鞍潛送石榴裙。
到時常晚歸時早，笑樂三分校一分。
translate: Please enjoy the time together as the sun has not set yet, and your thoughts of returning to distant neighborhoods are already scattered. It's okay to travel at a leisurely pace during the moonlight, why run away from the cup like a cloud? Resolutely leave behind the silver candle in the willow-lined path, and silently send off the golden saddle with the pomegranate skirt. When it's time to return late, laugh and enjoy three parts for one part.

poem:
主人晚入皇城宿，問客裴回何所須。
池月幸閑無用處，今宵能借客遊無。
translate: The host stays late in the imperial city, asking the guest what they need to linger. The pool moon is fortunate to have no use, can it be borrowed for the guest's entertainment tonight?

poem:
小妓攜桃葉，新聲蹋柳枝。
妝成剪燭後，醉起拂衫時。
繡履嬌行緩，花筵笑上遲。
身輕委迴雪，羅薄透凝脂。
笙引簧頻煖，箏催柱數移。
樂童翻怨調，才子與妍詞。
便想人如樹，先將髮比絲。
風條搖兩帶，煙葉貼雙眉。
口動櫻桃破，鬟低翡翠垂。
枝柔腰嫋娜，荑嫩手葳蕤。
唳鶴啨呼侶，哀猨夜呌兒。
玉敲音歷歷，珠貫字纍纍。
袖爲收聲點，釵因赴節遺。
重重遍頭別，一一拍心知。
塞北愁攀折，江南苦別離。
黃遮金谷岸，綠映杏園池。
春惜芳華好，秋憐顏色衰。
取來歌裏唱，勝向笛中吹。
曲罷那能別，情多不自持。
纏頭無別物，一首斷腸詩。
translate:
Minor courtesans carry peach leaves, their new voices tread on willow branches. 
Dressed up and cutting candles, drunk and waking to brush off their sleeves. 
Delicately walking in embroidered shoes, laughing at a flowery banquet slowly. 
Their bodies are light like falling snow, their silk gowns reveal their smooth skin. 
The flute plays softly, the zither's strings move frequently. 
The musicians play sad tunes, the talented writers compose beautiful words. 
Thinking of people as trees, their hair compared to silk threads. 
The wind sways the belts, smoke wraps their eyebrows. 
Their lips move like cherries, their tresses hang low like emeralds. 
Their waists sway gently, their hands are tender like shoots. 
The crane calls for its partner, the monkeys cry at night. 
Jade rings make sounds, pearls form words. 
Their sleeves make noises, their hairpins drop at the right time. 
They sing repeatedly, they know the beats in their hearts. 
In the north, they long for their loved ones, in the south, they suffer from parting. 
The yellow river banks cover with gold, the green waters reflect the apricot gardens. 
In spring, they cherish the beauty of flowers, in autumn, they pity the fading colors. 
Singing these songs is better than playing the flute. 
After the performance, they cannot part, their emotions overwhelm them. 
There are no other gifts but a heart-wrenching poem.

poem:
煙景冷蒼茫，秋深夜夜霜。
爲思池上酌，先覺甕頭香。
未暇傾巾漉，還應染指嘗。
醍醐慙氣味，琥珀讓晶光。
若許陪歌席，須容散道場。
月終齋戒畢，猶及菊花黃。
translate:
Mists and cold vagueness, autumn night with frost. 
Thinking of toasting by the pond, I sense the aroma from the jar. 
I haven't time to pour and drip, but should still taste with my fingers. 
Truly sorry for not having the flavor of nectar, let alone the luster of amber. 
If allowed to accompany the song gathering, allow me to disperse in the way. 
After the end of the lunar month and the ritual purification, it's still time for chrysanthemum flowers to be yellow.

poem:
老去媿妻兒，冬來有勸詞。
煖寒從飲酒，衝冷少吟詩。
戰勝心還壯，齋勤體校羸。
由來世間法，損益合相隨。
translate: As I grow old, I feel ashamed in front of my wife and children. In winter, there are words of encouragement. Warmth and coldness come from drinking wine; recite poetry less during the cold season. Victory over my heart makes me strong; through fasting, my body becomes leaner. Since ancient times, the laws of the world have combined benefits and losses.

poem:
忽辭洛下緣何事，擬向江南住幾時。
每過渡頭應問法，無妨菩薩是船師。
translate: Suddenly leaving the Luoyang area, why is it? Planning to stay in the south of the Yangtze River for a while. Every time at the ferry, ask about the dharma; It's okay, the Buddha is the shipmaster.

poem:
細吟馮翊使君詩，憶作餘杭太守時。
君有一般輸我事，柘枝看校十年遲。
translate: I gently recite Feng Yi's poem, remembering when he was the prefect of Yuhang. You have a similar story to share with me, watching the pomegranate branches for ten years late.

poem:
霜繁脆庭柳，風利剪池荷。
月色曉彌苦，鳥聲寒更多。
秋懷久寥落，冬計又如何。
一甕新醅酒，萍浮春水波。
translate: The dense frost bends the delicate courtyard willows, and the strong wind cuts through the pond's lotus leaves. The moonlight shines through the bitter morning, and the birds' cries are even more chilling in the cold winter air. My heart has been lonely for a long time, and I wonder what the winter plans hold. A jug of new wine is ready, floating on the spring water waves.

poem:
酒熟無客來，因成獨酌謠。
人間老黃綺，地上散松喬。
忽忽醒還醉，悠悠暮復朝。
殘年多少在，盡付此中銷。
translate: The wine is ready, but no guests have arrived, so I become a solo drinker. In the human world, old Huang Qi and his son are scattered on the ground, like pine and cypress trees. Suddenly awake, then drunk; slowly evening turns to morning. How much time is left in my remaining years, all spent here in this moment.

poem:
與君細話杭州事，爲我留心莫等閑。
閭里固宜勤撫恤，樓臺亦要數躋攀。
笙歌縹緲虛空裏，風月依稀夢想間。
且喜詩人重管領，遙飛一醆賀江山。
translate: Spend time with you to talk about Hangzhou matters, pay attention for me without being casual. Be sure to take care of the neighborhoods and visit the towers frequently. The sound of the flute and songs float in the air, and the wind and moonlight are faintly visible in dreams. Rejoice that the poet has regained control, and raise a cup in celebration of the beautiful landscape

poem:
渺渺錢唐路幾千，想君到後事依然。
靜逢竺寺猨偷橘，閑看蘇家女採蓮。
故妓數人憑問詢，新詩兩首倩留傳。
舍人雖健無多興，老挍當時八九年。
translate: The vast Qiantang River stretches for thousands of miles, I imagine you're still there after all these years. In quiet encounters, monkeys steal oranges from the Zen temple, while leisurely, one watches Su family girls harvesting lotus. Former courtesans are questioned, new poems are left to be passed on. Although the minister is healthy, his enthusiasm has waned, and he was 89 years old at the time.

poem:
漸老只謀歡，雖貧不要官。
唯求造化力，試爲駐春看。
translate: As I grow older, I only seek joy; though poor, I don't crave office. I seek the power of nature, trying to hold spring in place.

poem:
山路難行日易斜，煙村霜樹欲棲鵶。
夜歸不到應閑事，熱飲三杯即是家。
translate: The difficult mountain path grows easier as the sun sets, and smoke-filled villages and frost-covered trees are home to crowing ravens. Returning home at night should be a leisurely affair, for three cups of warm drink make any place feel like home.

poem:
草色斑斑春雨晴，利仁坊北面西行。
踟躕立馬緣何事，認得張家歌吹聲。
translate:
Muddy grass and splotchy rain, the sun shines through in spring. 
Heading north from Liren Mansion, I walk westward with a stumble. 
Halted by what unknown cause, I recognize the song and music of Zhang's family.

poem:
洛陽堰上新晴日，長夏門前欲暮春。
遇酒即沽逢樹歇，七年此地作閑人。
translate: On a sunny day in Luo Yang Dyke, at the beginning of a long summer, before the end of spring. Encountering wine and trees, I rest; seven years here, a leisurely man.

poem:
村杏野桃繁似雪，行人不醉爲誰開。
賴逢山縣盧明府，引我花前勸一杯。
translate: The village apricots and wild peaches are abundant like snow, for whom does the traveler not get drunk to enjoy them? Fortunately, I meet the Lu Mingfu, the magistrate of Shanyuan County, who leads me to a cup of wine before the flowers.

poem:
路傍埋骨蒿草合，壁上題詩塵蘚生。
馬死七年猶悵望，自知無乃太多情。
translate: The bones buried beside the road are covered with weeds, and poems on the wall are growing moss. Seven years after the horse's death, I still yearn for it, knowing that perhaps I am too sentimental.

poem:
野店東頭花落處，一條流水號羅敷。
芳魂豔骨知何處，春草茫茫墓亦無。
translate: The wild shop at the east end of the flowers, a stream flows and calls for Luo Fu. Where is the fragrant soul and beautiful bones? Even the grave in the vast spring grass is nonexistent.

poem:
大斾擁金羈，書生得者稀。
何勞問官職，豈不見光輝。
赫赫人爭看，翩翩馬欲飛。
不期前歲尹，駐節語依依。
translate: The golden reins hold the large banner, a bookworm's gain is rare. Why bother about official positions? Don't they see the radiance? Brilliant people compete to gaze, graceful horses want to fly. Unexpectedly, last year's magistrate, his words linger on.

poem:
夜飲歸常晚，朝眠起更遲。
舉頭中酒後，引手索茶時。
拂枕青長袖，欹簪白接䍦。
宿酲無興味，先是肺神知。
translate: Drinking at night often returns late, and getting up early is even later. Raising my head after drinking, I reach for tea when I want to. The green sleeves brush the pillow, and the white turban is tilted. After the hangover has no interest, it's originally from the spirit of the lungs.

poem:
洛川汝海封畿接，履道集賢來往頻。
一復時程雖不遠，百餘步地更相親。
朱門陪宴多投轄，青眼留歡任吐茵。
聞道郡齋還有酒，花前月下對何人。
translate: The Luo River and the Ru Sea connect the capital, and the path of the scholars is frequently traveled. Although the time is not far away, and the distance is less than a hundred steps, they are more intimate. At the red gate, there are many people accompanying the banquet, and the green eyes are left to rejoice and spit on the carpet. It is said that there is still wine in the county office, and who is facing each other under the flowers and the moon?

poem:
山僧對棊坐，局上竹陰清。
映竹無人見，時聞下子聲。
translate: The mountain monk plays chess, with the bamboo shade clear on the board. Unseen by anyone, the sound of moving pieces can be heard occasionally.

poem:
小娃撐小艇，偷採白蓮迴。
不解藏踪跡，浮萍一道開。
translate: The small child paddles the small boat, secretly gathering white lotuses. Unaware of their trail, a channel through the duckweed opens up.

poem:
素是自然色，圓因裁製功。
颯如松起籟，飄似鶴翻空。
盛夏不銷雪，終年無盡風。
引秋生手裏，藏月入懷中。
麈尾斑非疋，蒲葵陋不同。
何人稱相對，清瘦白鬚翁。
translate:
Pure, it's nature's natural hue, round, crafted by human hands.
Resembling the sound of pines making music, drifting like cranes in the sky.
In midsummer, it doesn't melt away, through the year, the wind never dies.
It guides autumn to our hands, and hides the moon within our breast.
The spotted bamboo is not equal, the coarse fan is different in its rest.
Who would call this a match? A thin, pale, bearded old man.

poem:
妓房匣鏡滿紅埃，酒庫封瓶生綠苔。
居士爾時緣護戒，車公何事亦停杯。
散齋香火今朝散，開素盤筵後日開。
隨意往還君莫怪，坐禪僧去飲徒來。
translate: The brothel's mirror is covered with red dust, and the wine cellar's sealed bottles are growing green moss. At that time, the layman followed his vows to protect his vows, and Lord Car was also pausing from his drink for unknown reasons. Today, the incense and candles are scattered in the dispersed vegetarian banquet, and in the future, the plain dishes will be laid out. Please do not blame me for coming and going as I please; it is the meditation monk who has left, and the drinkers have arrived.

poem:
午後郊園靜，晴來景物新。
雨添山氣色，風借水精神。
永日若爲度，獨遊何所親。
仙禽狎君子，芳樹倚佳人。
蟻鬬王爭肉，蝸移舍逐身。
蝶雙知伉儷，蜂分見君臣。
蠢蠕形雖小，逍遙性即均。
不知鵬與鷃，相去幾微塵。
translate: Afternoon in the suburban garden is quiet, the scenery is fresh and sunny. The rain adds to the hue of the mountains, the wind borrows the spirit of the water. How should I spend the long day, who can I be close to alone? The immortal birds are familiar with the gentleman, the fragrant trees lean on the beautiful woman. Ants fight for meat, snails move houses and follow their bodies. Butterfly pairs know each other as a couple, bees divide into rulers and subjects. Although the insects are small, they have equal joy. I don't know if the peng and yan, separated by a few dust.

poem:
白頭種松桂，早晚見成林。
不及栽楊柳，明年便有陰。
春風爲催促，副取老人心。
translate: Planting pine and laurel, white hair to gray; Soon an evergreen forest you shall see. Not as fast as planting willow trees, Next year a shade you shall obtain. Spring winds hasten the growth, Fulfilling the old man's desire.

poem:
從君種楊柳，夾水意如何。
準擬三年後，青絲拂綠波。
仍教小樓上，對唱柳枝歌。
translate: From your planting willows, between the water, how does it look? I plan for three years later, with green strands caressing the green waves. Still let's sing "Willow Branch Songs" on the small tower.

poem:
更想五年後，千千條麴塵。
路傍深映月，樓上闇藏春。
愁殺閑遊客，聞歌不見人。
translate: I long for five more years, a thousand silks turning to dust. The road is deep in shadow by the moonlight, and spring hides in the darkness of the tower. The leisurely traveler feels sorrow, hearing songs but not seeing people.

poem:
好官病免曾三度，散地歸休已七年。
老自退閑非世棄，貧蒙強健是天憐。
韋荆南去留春服，王侍中來乞酒錢。
便得一年生計足，與君美食復甘眠。

移牀避日依松竹，解帶當風挂薜蘿。
鈿砌池心綠蘋合，粉開花面白蓮多。
久陰新霽宜絲管，苦熱初涼入綺羅。
家醞瓶空人客絕，今宵爭奈月明何。
translate: Moving the bed to avoid the sun and lean on pine and bamboo, untying the belt in the wind and hanging moss. The inlaid pool is filled with green duckweed, and the face of the flower opens to reveal many white lotuses. It has been a long period of overcast weather, but it's suitable for musical instruments now that the weather has cleared up. As the heat subsides, one enters the elegant robe. There are no more guests at home, and tonight, how can we cope with the bright moon?

poem:
水色昏猶白，霞光闇漸無。
風荷搖破扇，波月動連珠。
蟋蟀啼相應，鴛鴦宿不孤。
小僮頻報夜，歸步尚踟躕。
translate: The water's color is still hazy and white, the rosy hues are fading away. The wind shakes the lotus leaves like broken fans, the moonlight ripples like beads. Crickets chirp in harmony, mandarin ducks rest without loneliness. The little boy frequently announces the night, his steps are still hesitant as he returns.

poem:
小宅里閭接，疎籬雞犬通。
渠分南巷水，窗借北家風。
庾信園殊小，陶潛屋不豐。
何勞問寬窄，寬窄在心中。
translate: In the small villa, adjacent lanes and courtyards connect; through the sparse hedges, chickens and dogs pass. The canal divides the water from the south lane, while the window borrows the wind from the north home. Yuan Xian's garden is quite small, and Tao Qian's house is not lavish. Why bother asking about width and narrowness? It's all in our hearts.

poem:
適情處處皆安樂，大抵園林勝市朝。
煩鬧榮華猶易過，優閑福祿更難銷。
自憐老大宜疎散，却被交親歎寂寥。
終日相逢不相見，兩心相去一何遙。
translate: Where your heart is, there is peace and happiness; generally, gardens are better than bustling cities. It's easy to endure the hustle and bustle of prosperity, but it's hard to get rid of leisurely blessings. I feel that I should be more relaxed as I grow older, but my friends lament the loneliness. We meet all day but don't see each other; our hearts are so far apart.

poem:
隼旟歸洛知何日，鶴駕還嵩莫過春。
惆悵香山雲水冷，明朝便是獨遊人。
translate: When will the falcon's banner return to the Luoyang, and the crane's carriage return to Mount Song in spring? As the clouds and water at Mount Baiyue grow cold, tomorrow I will be a solitary traveler.

poem:
柳枝謾蹋試雙袖，桑落初香嘗一杯。
金屑醅濃吳米釀，銀泥衫穩越娃裁。
舞時已覺愁眉展，醉後仍教笑口開。
慙媿故人憐寂寞，三千里外寄歡來。
translate: The willow branches are lightly brushed, trying on twin sleeves; the first fragrance of mulberry fallen is tasted from a cup. The golden grains ferment into wine with strong flavor, brewed from fine Wu rice; the silver clay garments are tailored for the steady Yue children. Dancing, one already feels the frowning brows unfold; after drunkenness, the smiling mouth remains open. Feeling ashamed and grateful for the kindness of the old friends, who send joy from three thousand miles away.

poem:
同州慵不去，此意復誰知。
誠愛俸錢厚，其如身力衰。
可憐病判案，何似醉吟詩。
勞逸懸相遠，行藏決不疑。
徒煩人勸諫，只合自尋思。
白髮來無限，青山去有期。
野心惟怕鬧，家口莫愁飢。
賣却新昌宅，聊充送老資。
translate: Tired of staying in the same place, who can understand this feeling? Truly loving your salary and wealth, yet weakened by physical fatigue. It's pitiful to diagnose cases, better to drink and recite poetry. Labor and leisure are far apart, one's actions and storage are never doubted. It's useless to be advised, just think for yourself. White hair comes without end, the green hills will always be there. Fear the hustle and bustle, don't worry about hunger at home. Sell the new estate, use it as a retirement fund.

poem:
西戶最榮君好去，左馮雖穩我慵來。
秋風一筯鱸魚鱠，張翰搖頭喚不迴。
translate: The most honored gentleman goes to the west door, and although the left Feng is stable, I am lazy to come. In the autumn breeze, a strand of silvery carp fish meat is used, and Zhang Han shakes his head and cannot be called back.

poem:
離筵莫愴且同歡，共賀新恩拜舊官。
屈就商山伴麋鹿，好歸芸閣狎鵷鸞。
落星石上蒼苔古，畫鶴廳前白露寒。
老監姓名應在壁，相思試爲拂塵看。
translate: The banquet is a time to celebrate and enjoy, together we honor the new appointment and old friends. Resigned to spend time with the deer and the elk in Shang Mountain, we eagerly return to our studies with the phoenix and the peacock in the library. The ancient moss on the Star-falling Stone is thick, and the dew before the Painting Crane Hall is chilly. The names of the old guardians should still be on the wall, let's wipe away the dust and reminisce.

poem:
新酒此時熟，故人何日來。
自從金谷別，不見玉山頹。
疎索柳花盌，寂寥荷葉杯。
今冬問氈帳，雪裏爲誰開。
translate: The new wine is ripe at this time, when will my old friends come? Since parting in Golden Valley, I have not seen the jade mountains crumbling. The willow catkins are sparse in the bowl, and the lotus leaves are lonely in the cup. This winter, I ask if the felt tent is open for whom in the snow.

poem:
禍福茫茫不可期，大都早退似先知。
當君白首同歸日，是我青山獨往時。
顧索素琴應不暇，憶牽黃犬定難追。
麒麟作脯龍爲醢，何似泥中曳尾龜。
translate: The fate is vast and unpredictable, mostly retiring early like a prophet. When you return to the white head with the emperor, it's my time to wander in the green mountains alone.
